entries.meaning: (mathematics, of a map) Both injective and surjective.
examples: Then, by a straightforward, computable, bijective numerical coding, this idealized FORTRAN determines an EN.[effective numbering] (Note: In this FORTRAN example, we could have omitted restrictions on I/O and instead used a computable, bijective, numerical coding for inputs and outputs to get another EN determined by FORTRAN.)

entries.meaning: (mathematics) Having a component that is (specified to be) a bijective map; that specifies a bijective map.
examples: Proving the conjecture is equivalent to constructing a PCP that reads 2 symbols and accepts iff these symbols satisfy a bijective constraint.
